definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Your willingness to sacrifice countless late nights consoling them?
sentences.chinese: 或者是因爲你願意花費無數的夜晚去安慰他們？

sentences.english: A large sum of money was spent in building the tower.
sentences.chinese: 建造那座塔花費大量錢財。

sentences.english: Do you know how much you spend on clothes and groceries annually?
sentences.chinese: 你知道你每年要爲衣服和雜貨花費多少嗎？

sentences.english: Are the program effects attainted at a reasonable cost?
sentences.chinese: 爲取得計劃效果所花費的成本是否合理？

sentences.english: Anexpensive brassiere will cost less than an expensive handbag.
sentences.chinese: 一款高檔胸罩比一個高檔手袋花費的要少得多。

sentences.english: Why do companies spend so much on accountants?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼一個公司要花費那麼多來僱傭會計人員？

sentences.english: Chinese tour operators are notorious for bargaining down travel and hotel costs.
sentences.chinese: 中國旅行團因爲在旅行和賓館花費上砍價而臭名昭著。

sentences.english: Baby giant pandas spend a lot of time drinking their mum's milk.
sentences.chinese: 小熊貓花費大量的時間喝他們媽媽的奶水。

sentences.english: That's right,Nigel. I think we can keep cost down .
sentences.chinese: 一點也沒錯，奈傑爾，我們認爲花費可以降低。

sentences.english: For a 60-watt incandescent, it’s just over $7 per year.
sentences.chinese: 一個60瓦白熾燈一年要花費7美元。

sentences.english: You really shouldn't spend so much effort on it.
sentences.chinese: 你真不該在這件事上花費這麼大的精力。

sentences.english: That alone will cost you nearly $4444 a year.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅這樣每年就會花費你將近4444美元。

sentences.english: First and foremost, we needto develop better tests that don't require expensive imaging.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我們要發展更好的花費少的成像檢查。

sentences.english: It has taken a long time to wade through the 'incredible volume' of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 看完這一大卷“長篇累牘”的證詞花費了很長的時間。

sentences.english: “The cost would be a ridiculous figure,” he says.
sentences.chinese: “其花費將是一個天文數字，”他說。

sentences.english: You will gain some rewards but the points are not spendable .
sentences.chinese: 你能得到一些獎勵，但是它們本身是不可花費的。

definition: saving/to save/to use sparingly/to cut down on
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
